TextBody:
Hey Sudhir,

Would you be able to send the information contained in the logs I sent in the previous email in this thread to Mimecast to see what they think? Our engineering team is hoping they may be able to find something in their logs at the same time that may indicate why we are receiving bad credentials.

Thanks!
Andrew

Engineering has continued investigating the issue and tried sending a test email with the credentials provided. Here is a snippet of their testing where they received the following (bad credentials):

220 cim5d26.hosted.endpointprotector.com ESMTP Sendmail 8.15.2/8.15.2/Debian-22ubuntu3; Thu, 31 Oct 2024 13:21:29 GMT; (No UCE/UBE) logging access from: localhost(OK)-localhost [127.0.0.1]
>>> EHLO cim5d26.hosted.endpointprotector.com

>>> RCPT To:<flaviu.costras@netwrix.com>

>>> .

050 250-STARTTLS
050 250 HELP
050 >>> STARTTLS
050 220 Starting TLS [LIrhMjyFM2-cBQSIPYYd-g.de62]
050 >>> EHLO cim5d26.hosted.endpointprotector.com
050 250-de-smtp-outbound-1.mimecast.com Hello [3.233.76.139]
050 250-AUTH PLAIN LOGIN
050 250 HELP
050 >>> AUTH LOGIN
050 334 VXNlcm5hbWU6
050 >>> <<<REDACTED>>> - we checked and it's the correct username setup
050 334 UGFzc3dvcmQ6
050 >>> <<REDACTED>> - we checked that the password is the same saved in the email config
050 535 Incorrect authentication data -  https://community.mimecast.com/docs/DOC-1369#535 [LIrhMjyFM2-cBQSIPYYd-g.de62]

250 2.0.0 49VDLTod1336896 Message accepted for delivery
flaviu.costras@netwrix.com... Sent (49VDLTod1336896 Message accepted for delivery)
Closing connection to [127.0.0.1]
>>> QUIT
221 2.0.0 cim5d26.hosted.endpointprotector.com closing connection

Our engineers made sure to verify that the credentials transmitted were the same ones found in the configuration file. Are the current credentials still valid? If they are not, could you please change them and resend the test email found in the management console UI?
Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns,
Thanks,
Andrew
